page.title: 15A day at the berries
page.content: The{berries}are hard work.You start as early as 7.30 am and finish at 4.30 pm.You are given a crate which has sixteen trays. Depending on the weight, you can get 40p to 50p a crate. When you start in the morning you're given a dreel or row. You take a metal frame to carry your crate. In the morning it is cool and easy to pick, but as the day goes on it gets very hot. I like the{raspberries}better than the{strawberries.}At the raspberries you don't have to bend down. The berries start at the end of June and end in August. I usually save up all my berry money and spend it all after the summer holidays.I think the one thing that keeps you going is knowing you're earning money.
